title: Greek economy minister welcomes his country's recovery
description: After enduring years of austerity measures and a historic depression, Greece's economy has shown signs of recovery. Kostis Hatzidakis, who maintains a cautious approach, emphasizes the importance of reducing debt while addressing tax evasion.

title: Israeli airstrike of Gaza's refugee camp leaves dozens dead
description: Israel confirmed its armed forces carried out an airstrike on the Jabalia refugee camp, saying it killed a top Hamas commander involved in the October 7 attacks.

title: The Gaza Strip: 20 years of Le Monde covering this increasingly inaccessible territory
description: Correspondents describe the particular context of the Palestinian enclave, which despite experiencing four conflicts between 2008 and 2021, has received less attention from the media than the West Bank.

title: Louvre Abu Dhabi: A  twist in the antiquities trafficking case?
description: German art dealer Serop Simonian, who has been suspected of selling objects of dubious provenance to the museum, was extradited to France in mid-September.

title: World Cup 2034: After Australia's withdrawal, Saudi Arabia is sole bidder to host the competition
description: On Tuesday, the Australian Football Association announced that it was abandoning its bid to host the 2034 World Cup. The Saudi kingdom has never been so close to becoming the tournament's host country.

title: Hezbollah wavers over launching a second front against Israel
description: The most fervent Hezbollah militants do not understand why it has taken so long for Hezbollah to react to the war between Israel and Hamas. Others question the advisability of a new war at a time when Lebanon is already in crisis.

title: Israel-Palestine: Six videos to understand the context behind the war in Gaza
description: Le Monde breaks down the historical and contemporary context behind the conflict in these short explainer videos.

title: Israeli hostages: Netanyahu's war cabinet is determined to force Hamas to fold
description: Israeli forces are stepping up their military operations in the Gaza Strip while claiming to be pursuing their objective of freeing prisoners of the Islamist movement.

title: Paris prosecutor opens investigation after Stars of David found tagged on buildings
description: The town hall in the 14th arrondissement denounced these taggings in their district as 'anti-Semitic acts.' Similar tags have appeared in recent days in Paris suburbs.

title: 'Carbon bombs' threaten the fight against global warming
description: An investigation published by Le Monde and based on the work of two French NGOs on 422 fossil fuel extraction megaprojects highlights the cognitive dissonance of governments that continue to authorize fossil fuel projects while claiming to be committed to the energy transition.

title: US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan: 'Protecting civilians in Gaza is a moral and strategic necessity'
description: In an exclusive interview, National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan explains why the Biden administration feels there is 'a moral and a strategic necessity' to protect Palestinian civilians in the Gaza Strip, as the Israeli army pushes its ground offensive in the northern part of the territory.

title: French police shoot and wound woman who 'made threats' at Paris train station
description: The woman had 'refused to comply with police orders' and threatened 'to blow herself up,' according to a police source. A police officer fired once, seriously wounding her.

title: ArcelorMittal asked to leave Kazakhstan following tragedy in Kostenko coal mine
description: A coal mine owned by the multinational company experienced a methane blast that killed 46 miners on October 28, leading Kazakh President Tokayev to call for the company's departure.

title: Messi wins eighth Ballon d'Or as Bonmati claims women's award
description: Lionel Messi received the Ballon d'Or from David Beckham, the co-owner of Inter Miami, on Monday.

title: 'Carbon bombs': Why climate preservation relies on halting all fossil fuel expansion projects
description: Existing infrastructure far exceeds the carbon budget required to stay below 1.5°C. The continued expansion of oil, gas and coal is incompatible with compliance with the Paris Agreement.

title: French interior minister dusts off plan to deport 'dangerous' Chechens
description: Since a terrorist attack in northern France earlier this month, Gérald Darmanin has spoken of resuming deportations to Russia, which have been suspended since the war in Ukraine started.

title: Carbon Bombs: The fossil fuel projects dooming the world's climate efforts
description: The operation of 422 huge oil, gas and coal fields is wiping out the chances of limiting global warming to 1.5°C. For the first time, two French NGOs have identified the companies, banks and governments behind these ticking time bombs.

title: In Barcelona, censored art now has its own museum
description: Since 2018, Catalan collector Tatxo Benet has purchased almost 200 artworks from around the world that were subjected to censorship for one reason or another. Around 40 of these are on display in his Museum of Forbidden Art, which opened on October 26.

title: Rome's cobblestone streets, embodiments of the Eternal City
description: With roadwork underway in the Italian capital for the 2025 Jubilee, the question of preserving the 'sampietrini' has resurfaced.

title: Sweden: Tesla employees strike to defend their wages and social model
description: The movement began on October 27 to protest the American brand's refusal to sign a Swedish collective bargaining agreement.

title: US auto strike: The workers' vote will be decisive in old industrial America
description: Will voters follow Donald Trump in his crusade against the unions and the environment, or Joe Biden, who wants to give industry a boost while ensuring a proper ecological transition?

title: The UK hosts the first global summit on the risks associated with artificial intelligence
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak wants to propose the creation of a group of international experts tasked with publishing a report on the state of AI.
